SECTION II: READING
Instructions:
In this section of the test, you will read some texts, and you will have to answer questions about
them. Choose the alternative by selecting the correct answer (a, b, c, or d).
Text 1
According to many scientific magazines, there are many reasons for older people to learn
something new. In addition to this, diseases can be prevented since it keeps your mind active,
so that everyone would be healthy. Furthermore, it is claimed that it helps boost self-esteem,
especially in elders.
One of the most important reasons for learning new things from a youthful age to prevent senile
dementia. It's been observed that the cause of people suffering the illness is because they are
not often involved in activities that let them expand their thinking capacity or when they do not
socialize anymore.
Among the activities that could help elders prevent or minimize the effects of dementia are
drawing, photography, cooking, painting, playing sudoku or completing crosswords, and much
more, but even more important, being acquainted with recent technologies is what can help
them significantly. Furthermore, they can be strengthened with a series of healthy and nutritious
diets and physical activities.
The learning process tends to decay when you turn twelve due to specific chemical alterations
in your brain as puberty appears. Then when you are thirty, the structure of the brain hardens.
That is why it is harder to learn as you grow up. Suffice it to say, all this poses a challenge, but
they might get it if they intend to do it Undoubtedly, it has been proved that the advantages of
keeping the learning process active after turning fifty markedly outweigh the drawbacks. If may
venture a guess, I'd say that it is not about the chances you have to study or the belief you are
too old; it is about self-determination. Bear in mind this. It's better late than never
21. After reading the text, what can be inferred?
o Readers might follow some of the suggestions in their personal lives.
o Readers will be willing to take some photography courses in the future.
o Readers might not feel satisfied with the info provided
o Readers will feel motivated to study or take a course.
22. According to the text, ...
o It's essential to prevent diseases after turning fifty.
o Continuing learning after turning fifty is an effective way to strengthen self-regard.
o Being healthy is the most important aspect of everyone's life.
o Magazines are a useful tool to boost elders' learning.
23. Which statement is not supported by the writer?
o Dementia is caused by not being able to study after the fifties.
o Illnesses can be avoided when people do several activities to keep their body and mind
active.
o Dementia can also happen elders stop interacting with others.
o A balanced diet can help prevent illnesses.
24. What's the main objective of this text?
o To point out the most essential thoughts to keep on learning after the fifties.
o To exemplify a wide range of activities elderly people can learn to keep their minds
active.
o To remark that it is never late to learn something.
o To draw people's attention to the importance of learning, and its benefits by the time
you are fifty.
25. It can be concluded that the author thinks that...
o People are obliged to learn something once they reach the age of fiftys.
o Emotional support for the elderly is essential to prevent senile dementia
o Having a nutritious diet, learning new things and socializing are the fundamental aspects
to prevent senile dementia.
o People are doomed to suffer from senile dementia after the age of fiftys.

Text 3: The role of technology
It is believed that technology is one of the most powerful, versatile, and noticeable resources
tools through which we are able to deal with tough things from different work studies medicine
and many other areas. Some people claim that it results from a long cultural and scientific
evolution, which has undoubtedly revolutionized humans lives.
One dear advantage is that technology gives people the chance of doing certain things that can
be too hard for their brains to get in a fleeting time. Another major positive aspect is that it helps
everyone to communicate with each other more easily and faster. In fact, people are now able
to share their anecdotes with others from vaned countries around the world On the other hand
over the years technology has become a general pitfall for all of us, since not everyone uses this
perk for good purposes. Should that be the case they use it to view of create sites that are
detrimental for the younger generations or for everyone, or sadly to make harmful comments
on social networks.
After all there is no denying that to use technology we must be incredibly careful since it will not
always be on our side. Notwithstanding benefits, there are those who argue it can be an
opportunity to harm ourselves or the people we love. Technology is at your fingerprint. What
you must do is just study entertain or work at your own pace and everything will be hunky-dory
Now that we are living in a highly technological world, we must be ready to face all the
challenges it embraces. As a student I may convey that technology opens doors and windows to
limitless learning. For instance, my sister is tackling a new type of learning experience, she is a
zoomer while her classmates are roomers and they interact as if they were in one learning space
even though she is at home and her peers are at school Technology is here to stay and remember
this, it is only limited by your imagination.

o technology is used only for good purposes.

Text 4
As most of you know, getting a job these days has been tough and for some people was like a
nightmare. Fortunately, got a new job! It was not rocket science!! must acknowledge that was
completely afraid of applying and that was the main reason why hadn't got one much earlier. In

Another wonderful thing about this is the building, which is considered the most amazing and

The most useful aspect of this ERP is the connection with a platform called Lumira, where you
can develop incredible reports online
One thing that I enjoy about this new company is that we can have small meetings with any
department because we can use a communication tool called "Teams". I believe that those small
meetings are more efficient than large ones.
This company has expanded so fast in the last three years, mainly because they have paid a lot

Finally, this job is better paid than my last dead-end job, and thus encompasses better social

Also, I will miss my friend from my last job, but we are going to be in touch. As we used to say,
a friend in need is a friend indeed.
I am extremely excited about this new opportunity, and will do my best to achieve the new
challenges.

situations, conversations or statements. Choose the alternative that best completes the blank
spaces by selecting the correct answer (a, b, c, or d).

o would - are - 'd

B: Agree, it's urgent. We _______ take things easy, though.

o better - 'd like

o am leaving - could graduate

B: You never drop by, _________ you want me to do you a favor.
o in order to - because
o since - just
o so that - unless
o so - in case
45.
A: I've just bought an energy efficient washing machine.
B: That's great! If you _______ this type of appliances, you ______ money on your electricity
bill.
o Using - will save
o will use - save
o use - save
o will use - will save

A: Would Peter like to go to the party with us?
B: I doubt it. He _______knows how to dance ________likes crowded places.
o Neither - or
o neither - nor
o either- nor
o either- and
47.
A: Today was supposed to be Felix and Giovanna's wedding, right?
B: Yeah. If Felix _____ into an accident, they _________ married right now.
o didn't get - would get
o hadn't gotten - would be getting
o wasn't getting - will get
o hasn't gotten - will be getting
48.

B: Not really. I ____ just ______when they found me.

o took - was - falling
o were taking - have - fallen
o took - have – fallen
49.
A: John was absent, ____a day off?
B: Actually, he _____ a cold
o Did he took - catched
o Was he take - catch
o Did he take - caught
o Was he took – caught
50.
A: Attendance ______ extremely important in this course. We'd better come to every class.
B: Oh, no! My boss said that, starting next month, some work meetings ______very late. I
hope I make it to class on time.
o considered - will schedule
o will consider - are scheduling
o is considered - are going to be scheduled
o be considered - will be scheduled
51.
A: The boss was here and he wanted to know where _______. He said that he __________the
documents on your desk.
B: Thanks! I'll review them immediately.
o you were - was leaving
o you are - is leaving
o you would be - has left
o were you – left
52.
A: What are your plans for this weekend?
B: I ________ a wedding on Saturday evening and on Sunday... maybe I _______home.
o will be attending - am going to stay
o attend - will just be staying
o am attending - will just stay
o will attend - am just staying
53.
A: How long had Sue been looking for a job?
B: _______last year. She _______almost ______hope.
o For - was - lost
o Since - had - lost
o All- have - lost
o Since - has – lost
54.
A: What ________?
B: I work as a programmer and he ________part-time at a restaurant.
o you and Tom do - does work
o do you and Tom do - works
o does you and Tom do - works
o do you and Tom does – work
55.
A: Tell us about your work experience, please.
B: Over the years, I _____ in five advertising agencies. In the last one, I ________a promotion
only a few months after joining the company
o did work - have gotten
o worked - got
o worked - gotten
o have worked – got
56.
A: How ________?
B: Great! Although I _______much these days. The food here is hard on my stomach.
o your trip is going - am not eating
o does your trip go - don't eat
o your trip goes - eat
o is your trip going - am not eating
57.
A: ________ blue your favorite color?
B: Yes. Look! My hat and scarf ________ red.
o Am – are
o Is – are
o Are – is
o Is – am
58.
A: We ______ bring a dictionary to class, right? I can just use the app on my mobile.
B: Mm... I think you ______ bring one. The teacher doesn't let us use our mobiles in class
o are able to - may
o have to - can
o don't have to - should
o could - must
59.
A: The boss said that _________finished their reports early could leave for the day, so I rushed
to get home before 6:00
B: That's great! Now, you can relax and do _____you want.
o whoever - whatever
o whomever - anything
o everyone - whichever
o who – which
60.
I know you are tired, but if you _____with your homework, you _____ on time
o continue- won't finish
o will continue - would finish
o would finish - finish
o don't continue - won't finish
61.
A: The detective found evidence of illegal practice, so he ________
B: I hope the court doesn't _______with it.
o had arrested the doctors - let them
o had the doctors arrested - let them get away
o arrested the doctors - get them away
o got to arrest the doctors - get away
62.
A: Will you mail this present, please? It's for Bob.
B: You _____it more carefully. The box is breaking!
o should wrap
o will be wrapped
o must wrapped
o shouldn't be wrapped
63.
A: Basketball is ______soccer.
B: Maybe, but tennis is _____soccer.
o as more exciting as - the most exciting
o most exciting as - exciting than
o more exciting - the most exciting
o as exciting as - more exciting tan
64.
He didn’t _____ breakfast today because he forgot it at home.
o Have
o Having
o Has
o To have
65.
A: I enjoy to play PlayStation all night.
B: _________
o I’m not either
o I can’t either
o I don’t either
o Me too
66.
What are you going to do after ________?
o You graduate
o You’re going to graduate
o You’ll graduate
o You graduated
67.
Our neighbors are having their walls ____. It’s going to look so much better now.
o To Paint
o Painting
o Painted
o Paints
68.
If I had finishied my career, I probably ____ many more chances to have a better salary.
o Would have
o Would have had
o Am having
o Have had
69.
A: What _____ she doing yesterday at 5 in the afternoon?
B: She was studying
o Were
o Was
o Do
o Did
70.
We were so confused in Algebra, she should _____ us a difficult exam.
o Not have given
o Is give
o Giving
o To give
